abstract: The company said there was no indication that the deaths, which occurred away from its factories, were work-related.
snippet: The company said there was no indication that the deaths, which occurred away from its factories, were work-related.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Three Chinese employees at Foxconn, one of the world’s biggest contract electronics manufacturers, died in what were believed to be suicides in recent weeks, which a group that monitors labor conditions in China says is the latest indication that the company continues to be plagued by labor problems.

headline.main: Group Says Deaths Show Problems Remain at Foxconn
headline.print_headline: Group Says String of Deaths Shows Problems at Foxconn
